name: Oil refinement guide
description: So, you want to refine oil. In this project i share what i have learned about the aspects of oil refinement and it's tips/tricks.

entities.label: So, you want to refine oil

Input: 0.8l/s oil
Input: 0.2l/s water
Output: 1l/s petrol

3 Oil refineries
Input: 3l/s oil
Output: 3l/s petrol

Fuel Tanker used to move
oil from wells to refineries
in the absence of pipes

Mineseeker with tinder boxes allow
for faster pulling of oil and easy refueling

Store Oil in a fuel conatiner
near refineries for easier redueling

4 Oil refineries
Input: 4l/s oil
Output: 4l/s petrol

Output adjusted
to oil wells output:
3l/s petrol

Since human piping is not automatic,
extra oil refineries helps you burn
the petrol that you backlog faster
to keep up with production

5 Oil reformers
Input: 4l/s oil
Input: 1l/s water
Output: 5l/s petrol

Output adjusted
to oil wells output:
3.75l/s petrol

Pipe water to the oil reformers
to get more petrol out of your oil
if you feel like human pipe 2 liquids

Get an extra mineseeker with tinder boxes
to get the water into the refineries and make
liquid management easier

Every setup under tier1
it's under 12MW
one petrol plant
should suffice

5 Oil refineries
1 Craking unit
Input: 5.9375l/s oil
Output: 5l/s petrol
Output: 0.5625l/s heavy oil

Output adjusted to oil wells output:
4.6875~5l/s petrol 
0.375~0.5625l/s heavy oil

6 Oil refineries
Input: 6l/s oil
Output: 6l/s petrol

Output adjusted to oil wells output:
5.625l/s petrol

6 Oil reformers
1 Craking unit
Input: 5.7375l/s oil
Input: 1.2l/s water
Output: 6l/s petrol
Output: 0.5625l/s heavy oil

Output adjusted to oil wells output:
5.859375~6l/s petrol 
0.495~0.5625l/s heavy oil

If you are planning to upgrade to frackers with T3 facilities
build your chosen T3 template already to avoid the need
of flagging and destroying to rebuild
Try to use the minimmum amount of power plants required so that you limit your 24/7 petrool burned

Compact building


The hitbox of some buildings are different when placing their blueprints
so depending on what direction you stack them you can place them tighter together

Cursed pipes


Currently you can build pipes that cross each other
by placing their blueprints first and finishing them later

Put the power flexible
wherever you want
When planning tier3 oil fields you need to think about 2 points:

3 Frackers vs 2 Frackers 1 Electric well

Tier 3 oil fields rely on water to function, and thus if your water pumps gets destroyed
you will not only have to rebuild them but also kickstart the system once again manually.

If your water pumps are vulnerable and you don't want this to happen we can keep
1 electric oil well making heavy oil feeding a power station giving power to the systems
needed to kickstart the system.

2. How many cracking refineries for heavy oil do i need

If you are not planning on using heavy oil for power 2 craking units will satisfy your needs
and you can switch one of them to petrol production when you're not consuming it with 
heavy oil recipes. Sulfuric reactors is the most heavy oil hungry recipe in the game since 
it will run 24/7 and wont stop because it needs resources.

Add 1 extra cracking unit per sulfuric reactor you plan on running as a thumb rule.

2 Frackers
1 Electric oil well
Output: 6.875l/s oil

After knowing your number of cracking units add oil reformers
until you consume more than your oil wells produce


Oil wells output < HO * 0.9375 + P * 0.8


Where:
HO = number of cracking units
P = number of oil reformers

2 Frackers
1 Electric oil well
Input: ~1.667l/s water
Output: 6.875l/s oil

9 Oil reformers
1 Craking unit
Input: 8.1375l/s oil
Input: 1.8l/s water
Output: 9l/s petrol
Output: 0.5625l/s heavy oil

Output adjusted to oil wells output:
8.203125~9l/s petrol 
0.18~0.5625l/s heavy oil

6 Oil reformers
3 Craking unit
Input: 7.6125l/s oil
Input: 1.2l/s water
Output: 6l/s petrol
Output: 1.6875l/s heavy oil

Output adjusted to oil wells output:
5.078125~6l/s petrol 
1.245~1.6875l/s heavy oil

About cracking units


Remember that cracking units still have the option to use the default petrol recipe.
Thus consider switching to petrol production if you are backloging too much heavy oil

Additionally pipes can cross through buildings that they are connecting to.
For example:

Tinderbox access and LTS (Liquid transfer station)


Mineseekers pull items from stockpiles much faster than any other method, and,
since the oil refineries stock up to 32k cans of a given liquid they have become an
option to store liquids like LTS.

If you don't wan't to build enough foundations and LTS to avoid backlog liquids 
I highly recommend making your refineries accesible through mineseeker.

The downside that they have is that they are not visible from the map
and players that don't know this method might be confused.

Remember that if you don't want your backlog liquids to be useless:

Also, make the travel distance between refineries/LTS and
road/dock/train loop as short as possible for ease of use.

Thanks to: FMAT, CL, 82DK and TURBO for feedback
DM Menxs on discord for feedback

Pipe connections transfer liquids at ~2.5l/s in both directions
Since pipes are at best, unreliable assume ~2.3-2.4l/s.
If you stack a lot of pipes you will lose flow.
Use fuel silos to keep the flow up.
Disclaimer, pipes are not accurate do not assume 2.5l/s plan with overhead.
Inconsistent and not recommended if you need a high flow

Spread fuel silos at different intervals depending on the flow needed.
Usually a silo every 3 pipes is good enough for most cases.

LTS connections transfer liquids at 1/3 of a unit.
This means:
  Diesel: 33.33l/s
  Petrol/Oil/Water: 16.66l/s
  Heavy Oil/Enriched Oil: 10l/s
  Hella speedy
Using the extra speed of the LTS you can use a setup like this to your advantage.
Avoid using C-shape connections if possible.

Valves in game display rounded values like 0.2l/s, do not assume exact 0.20l/s
but a range of ~0.2-0.25l/s.

Since pipes don't reach the expected 2.5l/s and T3 Oil wells produce 2.5l/s
you need to use multiple pipes to manage the oil output.
Results of testing a distance of 1500m with Diesel
